channel.title: Little Anti-CSS trick
channel.description:
Instead of using the opacity property or filter(alpha) property you can just use a image, the image is like an entire fix to all browsers.
Heh, this trick is pretty easy to do. All you do is create a image of any color and set it's transparency to less then 90 for things to be seen in the background. Don't say anything if you know this, but this isn't posted until now so I am first to do this.
Anyways, once you make the transparent image you make it as the background of a tag (EG: [i]div[/i], [i]img[/i], [i]label[/i], etc.)
Example of this here: http://jarod-billingslea.freehostia.com/stuff/test/transparentnonecss.html
99% credit to make 1% credit to whatever gave me the idea of this lol
I didn't look at tut or steal this, or w/e you claim. 100% thought of and done. GL in the future with this.

item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

OMG I NEVER KNEW!!! fucking dumbass…

and I lol

/Fuck CSS glitches with browsers! PNG power!/
body{background: url(http://i35.tinypic.com/o9h9mv.jpg) repeat-x center;color:#FFFFFF;margin:0;padding:0;}

Anyways, once you make the transparent image you make it as the background of a tag (EG: div, img, label, etc.)
